- Given a MST with point set $P$ , denoted $MST(P)$ .
- Find one additional Steiner point $s$ so that the wire length of $MST(P \cup s)$ is shorter than $MST(P)$ .

## Naive method
- Find all possible 1-steiner points $P$ by [Hanan grid](https://www.wikiwand.com/en/Hanan_grid)
- For each 1-steiner points $s \in P$ , construct $MST(P \cup s)$ .
	- Find the MST with shortest wirelength.
- repeat above until no improvement.

## Heuristic method
- Use $\textrm{gain}$ to decide where to add steiner point.
- ![picture from book practical problems in VLSI physical design automation](https://i.imgur.com/CSV7xxH.png)
- $\textrm{gain}(p, e) = \textrm{length}(e_2) - \textrm{length}(p, p_1)$
	- $p \in P$ , $e \in MST(P)$
	- $e_2$ is the longest edge from $p$ to edge $e$ .
	- $p_1$ is the steiner point on hanan grid.
- for each edge $e \in MST(P)$
	- Find the largest $\textrm{gain}$ value
	- Sort descending as $E$ .
- for each $g \in E$
	- $g = \textrm{gain}(p, e)$
	- remove corresponding $e_2$ , and connect $p$ and $p_1$ .
	- If edge $e$ were removed by previous operation, just skip it.
- repeat above until no improvement.
